body: can you please create a codesandbox?

Unfortunately I started out with the controller and had more troubles.

Sorry Iâ€™m on my phone and donâ€™t have the resources to whip up an example. 

Basically, this bug would still happen but also when I called form.reset(dtoValuesFromServer); the form would reset to the first value that went into the controller rather than the values I was passing into form.reset if that makes sense. 

Personally, I much prefer the register/unregister version in our code (as Iâ€™ve seen it documented like that on your API guide) as it gives us a lot more control and flexibility. 

I am fairly confident that if I swap that conditional textbox to another component (Iâ€™ll try it with another radio option) it will still cause the same issue. 

Iâ€™ll add more verbose logging on the useEffect for form.register to and youâ€™ll notice ALL inputs unregister then re register themselves and default back to the values passed into useForm to begin with (so perhaps this is actually related to the incorrect behaviour I saw when using the Controller and form.reset) although in my current instance Iâ€™ve sent you guys Iâ€™m not using form.reset method at all - but thatâ€™s just a heads up.

@bluebill1049 Apologies, I don't think this is actually completely fixed :( 

If you follow the steps then type into the box a second time you can notice the radio option reset back to "yes". 

Also, at this point - if you change the value of the radio option back to no, the text in the conditional field will reset and you can no longer alter the value of the radio option.

This happens in the sandbox you sent, also: https://codesandbox.io/s/competent-yonath-fkxuc
